content:
This value set, I'd like to have translations for:
http://hl7-fhir.github.io/valueset-languages.html

Can someone send me a text file with Dutch translations for the codes in it?
thx
Sure, shall I update the build?
well, you could just add them directly, sure. thanks
Alternatively: https://nl.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1
that's useful but doesn't translate the languages just the countries
Sorry my bad: https://nl.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lijst_van_ISO_639-codes
probably they're there somewhere though. I didn't think of looking there
I'll locate the build file and update it
build\source\terminologies\valueset-languages.xml
What's the criterium for making the list? I'm missing nl-BE for example or et (Estonian)
Estonia has a large FHIR installment do they not?
I made the list by listing affiliates and adding the likely codes as far as I could tell
you can add nl-BE if you think you'll use it, and et too
Telugu? :-)
India is hard. but I have lots of personal friends who speak Telugu so I added it
should probably have added hindi as well
I'm committing including nl-BE and fr-BE, fy and fy-NL and leave the rest for the respective countries/languages.
Frysian is the second official language in The Netherlands. There is a Firefox version in Frysian afaik.
so I have a build problem, and they won't show up in the build until next week some time. But they're there, thanks
No problem, you're welcome

@Grahame Grieve On the topic of translations by the way. I noticed that the v3 source_nl.xml is not picked up in a way that I can find, while v2 source_nl.xml is. Eg.:
http://hl7-fhir.github.io/valueset-administrative-gender.html
http://hl7-fhir.github.io/v2/0001/index.html

Is that a known thing?

it's been broken since the introduction of CdoeSystem. the problem is in the expansion algorithm. I have a custom expansion algorithm for v2, but the normal expansion algorithm is not tranlsation enabled. On my list of things to do today
Ah nice. Although I realize the length of your list :-)
What's the right Dutch translation for "English (United States)"?
thx
Engels (Verenigde Staten)
thx
